titles.title: Washington-Rochambeau Revolutionary Route National Historic Trail Designation Act
To amend the National Trails System Act to designate the Washington-Rochambeau Revolutionary Route National Historic Trail.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks.

committee.subcommittee: National Parks, Recreation, and Public Lands
committee.name: House Resources

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 7/26/2006--Introduced. Washington-Rochambeau Revolutionary Route National Historic Trail Designation Act - Amends the National Trails System Act to designate a corridor of approximately 600 miles following the route taken by the armies of General George Washington and Count Rochambeau between Newport, Rhode Island, and Yorktown, Virginia, in 1781 and 1782, as the "Washington-Rochambeau Revolutionary Route National Historic Trail."
